title: Sri Lanka stocks slip over 1-pct in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock market plunged over 1.5% within the first hour of trade on Tuesday (31) following the announcement of the Cabinet to hike taxes back to 2019 levels and the questions on what will happen next, market participants said.
The main All Share Price Index fell 1.07 percent or 154.04 points to 8,077.29 at 1130 hrs.
The most liquid S&P SL20 slipped 1.93 percent or 52.45 points to 2,666.63.
The top losers were LOLC Holdings, Expolanka and Browns Investment. (Colombo/May31/2022)
